prompt: I have an audio and I need the transcript. Which app or AI tool can I use?

hidden_queries: best apps or AI tools for audio to transcript
audio transcription tools compare AI transcription
metadata.generated_search_query: best apps or AI tools for audio to transcript

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are solid apps/AI tools you can use to transcribe audio to text: Easy & popular Otter.ai – very common for meeting audio, quick uploads, decent accuracy. Audiobookfest
Rev (AI) – simple upload → transcript workflow; good balance of accuracy and ease. Useful AI+1
Temi – fast, cheap, good for clear audio. Useful AI
Sonix – good if you need multi-language support and automated translation. Useful AI
Trint – transcription + editing + search tools. Useful AI
Other options TranscribeMe – combines AI with optional human review for higher accuracy. Useful AI
Fireflies.ai – geared toward meetings, integrates with conferencing apps. ClickUp
ClickUp Brain MAX – broader workspace but includes decent AI transcription. ClickUp

sources.title: Transcribe audio with Google Gemini for free - here's how to do it
sources.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Google Gemini – free basic transcription (short files) via upload + prompt. Tom's Guide

sources.title: Transcribe audio with Google Gemini for free - here's how to do it
sources.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

citation_mappings.claim_text: How to pick Want free or cheap? Start with Google Gemini (short files) or Temi. Tom's Guide+1
Need high accuracy or multi-speaker? Rev, Sonix, Trint are stronger. Useful AI
For meeting recordings with live capture, Otter.ai or Fireflies are practical. Audiobookfest

sources.title: 9 Best AI Transcription Tools for 2025
sources.snippet: Conclusion In conclusion, AI transcription tools have come a long way in recent years, offering users accurate, affordable, and efficient solutions for converting audio and video files into text. By choosing the right tool that meets your specific needs and preferences, you can save time, effort, and resources in the transcription process.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Basic workflow: upload your audio file (MP3, WAV, etc.), wait for processing, then download/edit the text. Accuracy varies with audio quality and accents, so expect minor cleanup. Useful AI
